website_summaries.verdict: Calms the typical anxieties and worries of homeschool parents with real-world, faith-based advice from a veteran.
pros: Gently encourages burnt-out parents to not neglect themselves
Reminds you that education is a journey, not a race, and it's one you've chosen to walk together as a family
cons: While encouraging, it's questionable how well this approach would work for upper grades

customer_reviews.title: Can I give this 6 stars?
customer_reviews.text: Can I give this 6 stars? Because I would in a heartbeat. This book reassured my heart and brought rest to my mind. It addressed every doubt I had and even ones I didn't know I had! It should truly be required reading for any homeschooling mom. I read it every August, but I find myself revisiting the book throughout the school year for reassurance. The idea of teaching from a restful state changes how I homeschool and even how I parent. I wish there were a Parenting from Rest version of this book because the principle can benefit anyone who has children, not just homeschooling moms. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: aarvin

customer_reviews.title: Highlighted at least 3 times per page!
customer_reviews.text: Short, Biblical and practical application. Encouraging, eye opening, realistic, beautiful, truthful, and will stay on my to read every year list. (And maybe every 6 months!!)
customer_reviews.author: Mld0203

customer_reviews.title: Must-read for homeschool parents who are stressed out from the status quo.
customer_reviews.text: I want to recommend this delightful book to all homeschooling parents, especially mamas. Written in a clear, encouraging way, the author relates how she has modified her homeschool teaching style to a lifestyle that honors God, her abilities and responsibilities, and creates less tension and stress at home. Who doesn't need to hear those things? I plan to gift copies of this book to my new to homeschool mama friends. The author writes from a classical Christian homeschool perspective. I hope the information I have presented helps you to make an informed decision! If so, please vote by replying Yes to "Was this review helpful." Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dolly Garnecki

customer_reviews.title: ***BREATH OF FRESH AIR FOR YOUR SPIRIT AND SOUL***
customer_reviews.text: There is just not enough room for me to tell you how much I love this book. It was a complete game changer for me when I felt like I was underwater. I have dogeared pages, highlighted passages, underlined so many sentences, and tabbed pages. Her words are like soothing balm to a burn. It is the first book I recommend to a mom when she says she is thinking about homeschooling or is in the trenches. Amazing and a breath of fresh air for any mommas tired spirit.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Luna Cafe

customer_reviews.title: Must Read!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh sweet mama! Is your joy for schooling your precious children slipping away? You know deep in your heart that you are called to homeschool, but it's seems to be such a struggle. Read this book, cover to cover. Enjoy it slowly like a piece of chocolate. Discover teach from not a place of physical rest, for of rest in Christ, who called you for such a purpose as teaching your children.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Blah. Stressful
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to stop buying books recommended by my fellow homeschool moms. From the title, I thought this book would help me to relax and teach my children from an un-stress-ful place. But no. This book is basically a sermon with a lot of "Do This" commands. I read three pages and was exhausted. Amazon, Thank you, Thank you, for taking it back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Heavy on motivation, light on content
customer_reviews.text: Teaching from rest is a great concept and it is helpful to be reminded that we don’t need to do it all, relax, etc... But you don’t need a whole book to tell you that. This book never seems to get past the motivational fluff into the real meat of what teaching from rest actually looks like and how one might accomplish it oneself. I felt like it was a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: For all moms whether they homeschool or not.
customer_reviews.text: The perfect read for quarantine and our new homeschool venture. I don’t have any plans to homeschool but I learned so much from this book. One of the main ideas for teaching from rest is to focus less on checklists and more on relationships. Not getting too caught up in the short game, but realize you are in this for the long game. She makes teaching from rest clear and attainable. I think this book applies to all moms whether they homeschool or not. As a public school teacher, there were a couple ideas I thought could apply in the traditional classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa Rich

customer_reviews.title: overpriced for it's size and makes no sense
customer_reviews.text: This book is very small and very thin, so it's pretty overpriced for it's size. It was just ok, pretty much the same stuff you read in other homeschool books and web sites. Even by the time I was done I still didn't understand the teaching from rest thing seems like just a cute catch phrase or something. If your a homeschool mom you know that you are mothering children, preparing meals, doing laundry, keeping your house clean and teaching school full time, it's stressful and there is no rest. I felt guilty spending the 10 dollars for it once I got it. It was so small and I didn't really get much out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book saved me!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book saved my sanity and renewed my goals, my inspirations, and my love for motherhood, home-schooling, and poetry. I was reminded of the good things, the beautiful things, and the wholesome things to fight for, to give time for, and to love. I was reminded that bad days, weeks, or months happen and we shouldn't let that rule us. I was reminded that curriculum is a tool and shouldn't be allowed to dominate us or take away our joy in the journey of learning. This was simply the right book at the right time for me. I would HIGHLY recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Mann

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Religious
customer_reviews.text: If you want scripture and God to be the main source of guidance for your life and school focus, then this is for you. I have difficulty getting anything else out of this book so it is not good for secular or open minded spiritual people.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Walker

customer_reviews.title: Short Sweet book
customer_reviews.text: I pulled many nuggets from this good book. As i look into potentially homeschooling my daughter for preschool. Ultimately I want to be a mother filled with peace and joy. This book is a great reminder of what that would and could look like. In a world of all the hustle, bustle, and pushing our kids to be geniuses, it’s nice to just go back to the basics and find that as enough.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Cline

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Encouraging
customer_reviews.text: The first time I read this book, we were in our 7th year of homeschooling. It was such a needed balm for my heart. I was worn out, but the author's perspective energized me. She beautifully verbalized things that I knew but needed to be reminded of. Her approach helped me have realistic expectations and keep the big picture in mind. I've raved about "Teaching from Rest" to many homeschooling veterans and given it as a gift to many others considering homeschool. Thank you, Sarah McKenzie!
customer_reviews.author: New To Review

customer_reviews.title: Encouraging and practical advice
customer_reviews.text: This book helps you to identify the key areas where you can simplify and pull back so that there is peace in your homeschool. The author addresses curriculum, time, goals, relationships - all to help you identify what's truly important and keep your eye on the end goal. The thinking that I did while reading this book has been so helpful to me and has helped me to make changes to my homeschool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book is a MUST READ for home educators!
customer_reviews.text: This book is transformational in a Christian home educator's life. Exceptionally good for a classical educator, Sarah Mackenzie writes a convicting "how-to" without alienating those who aren't yet on board with her home educating plan. I loved this book so much that I have gifted it 9 times. Even if you LOVE your homeschooling efforts and can see no room for improvements - this book is still a MUST READ!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Scott

customer_reviews.title: Stop Teaching From Freaking Out
customer_reviews.text: Homeschooling is hard. Most of us make it harder on ourselves by regularly questioning or second-guessing everything from our curriculum to our choices of extra-curriculars. MacKenzie's gentle encouragement in this book is what every homeschool parent needs to refocus and relax. This short and sweet book is perfect for reading each summer while planning the next school year. I replaced my Kindle version for the paperback so I can highlight and flag pages. Buy this for yourself and a new homeschool parent you would like to encourage.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great book to focus moms on purposeful homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: Great book to focus moms on purposeful homeschooling. Don't let busyness and expectations rob you and your children of the joy the Lord wants for you! An easy read I will re-read in years to come. Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: Liza Janell

customer_reviews.title: Read this before you give up on homeschooling!
customer_reviews.text: This book has revolutionized our homeschool! I honestly don’t know if we’d have the strength to keep homeschooling for much longer with all the unnecessary burdens I was piling on myself and my children. TFR was a short, easy, enjoyable read and I have its author to thank for my bright new outlook on homeschooling. The Audible version is a must-have as well, like having the author in your home sharing her wisdom over a cup of coffee for younger moms like me who don’t have someone like her in their lives already.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended this book
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended this book! I have already recommended this book to a few of my close friends, who home school or planning to do so in the future. Sarah Mackenzie did an amazing job putting so many important feelings and ideas in to words. Buying this book I could not tell by the cover what she meant "Teaching from rest", but right the way it all made sense to me. And I already have been changing my ways of homeschooling my kiddos for the better way! Also, check out her amazing podcast "Read out loud revival".
customer_reviews.author: Margarita

customer_reviews.title: A must read.
customer_reviews.text: Possibly one of the most intelligently written books I have ever read. The author is obviously extremely intelligent and did a heck of a lot of research. I don't think there's a sentence in the book that isn't backed by research or can't be back by an expert. Absolutely and encouraging book for any homeschooling mom who wants to teach and maybe pushes themself too hard and one that really needs encouragement this is a must-read. I found myself wanting to share sentence after sentence with my friends who are in the same boat. Our homeschool Co-op all shared this book and just kept telling the next mom read this book read this book just so good!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Pitt

customer_reviews.title: Refreshing perspective
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely book. It was a short enough to read during a busy homeschool year. It was a positive and beautiful reminder that our children are created in the image of God. It is a great book for any homeschool parent. The author addresses the realities of educating our children at home while balancing normal life in the mix. I truly appreciated the Biblical wisdom included.
customer_reviews.author: nurse_d

customer_reviews.title: Soul Refreshing!
customer_reviews.text: This book was just what I needed. We are starting our second year of homeschool and I couldn't have come across this book at a better time! Our first year was challenging and although I looked forward to this year, a part of me dreaded it. This book spoke to me on such a level that I sat and cried. Thank you Sarah. Thank you for writing this book!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great book for homeschooling moms.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must read for any homeschooling Christian mom. It's short (about 80 pages) but jam packed with amazing insight and really focuses on the why and not the how. Highly recommend. Will be reading this over and over again every few months.
customer_reviews.author: newmom

customer_reviews.title: Not just for "homeschoolers" this book is a MUST-read if you have children or work with children!!
customer_reviews.text: I devoured this book in a couple of days and filled the pages with highlighted portions. I immediately passed it off to another friend for her to read. I will be RE-reading this book every year as I need a refreshment and reminder why we are educating our children. This book is applicable for any parent or educator though. I would highly recommend it if you work with children, you will be encouraged and inspired!
customer_reviews.author: chaqueequa

customer_reviews.title: Required reading!
customer_reviews.text: Encouragement, conviction, inspiration. My copy is full of highlights and areas I've underlined. This book is a homeschool treasure and deserves to be on the shelf of any Momma who forgets, sometimes, that her primary focus in educating her own is to lead them to God, and bathe them in Truth.
customer_reviews.author: Homeschool Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Slow down...it’s not about you. Teach from rest in Him!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this book. It is a short read but let’s be honest sometimes we need a nice short read to remind us to slow down and remember this is not about us but rather Him. Teaching in rest is something that takes him to implement and every time I feel like I am letting the comparison game take over, I read this book. Sarah is great author and wonderful person.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Gave me the freedom to approach homeschooling differently
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for a book club at our homeschool co-op. The year had been challenging and due to life circumstances we fell into an unschooling/relaxed homeschool style. While the Sara McKenzie talks about how she uses a classical approach the encouragement she gives really allowed me to evaluate what style best works for our family and how to implement it. She regularly discusses the importance of relationship first, clear vision and engaging the whole of the child. The two parts that particularly stood out were 1) the challenge to list 3-4 words you want your children to use to describe their homeschool experience, and 2) to surround your children with beauty, engaging thoughts, and big ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: this book was a great reminder of what my goals of homecoming really are
customer_reviews.text: This book is real, refreshing, and so uplifting. As a homeschooling mom of 7, one in high school too, this book was a great reminder of what my goals of homecoming really are, what really matters, and thr beauty of what I want my grown children to remember about their days at home. Teaching from rest - a fine balance between negligence and anxiety - is the place I want, need, and must be for my greatest gifts that call me mom to find the truth, beauty, and goodness in our homeschool. I'm so thankful for this little book. ♡
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: A must read for me!
customer_reviews.text: This book offered a fresh perspective to me on how to enjoy our homeschooling journey more and be at peace with how we do life together. It seems like such common sense after reading it but I had missed the mark on so many points. I plan on reading it at least once a year as a reminder of what is important in our school.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Honeybee

customer_reviews.title: This book was so lovely. What does it mean ...
customer_reviews.text: This book was so lovely. What does it mean to teach from rest? Such encouragement and written in such a way that you can read it on a few sittings and come back to it. The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is because I have only read it once and while reading it the pages where falling out. I was really hoping to go back and read it from time to time but don't think it will hold up to that kind of use. I am 'old school' and prefer a hard copy to an ebook.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: It helped me think through what we want homeschooling to look like for my family
customer_reviews.text: So thankful I found this at the beginning of our homeschooling journey! I was feelings no so much pressure about which curriculum to choose and wondering what was right for my kiddos and this really helped put my mind at ease. It helped me think through what we want homeschooling to look like for my family, has some practical suggestions for how to keep it simple but deep, and it is tremendously encouraging for homeschool families!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: If you're a homeschooling mama who generally feels stressed and ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're a homeschooling mama who generally feels stressed and stretched too thin in your attempts to check off all the boxes and cover everything your children need to learn...if you're worried about putting in a certain number of hours each day to make it "count" as school...if you worry all the time that you're going to ruin your children's education...then don't hesitate. Click immediately. Buy this book, read it today (it's short), and immediately start your new, more peace-filled approach to homeschooling!
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: So encouraging!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this audio book! I've been wanting to read this for quite a while so I finally purchased it on audio. I listened to the whole thing in 2 days! I do wish I had the print version to refer to some of her practical suggestions, but the main point of this book is to change your outlook and bring peace, and it certainly delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Best homeschooling book!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down one of the best, if not the best, book I have read as a homeschooling mom! I have bought it for so many who are beginning to homeschool and have read it over and over myself. Sarah keeps the main thing, the main thing, while encouraging and reminding us moms that it is possible to home school our kids with unshakable peace! Peace that only comes from trusting in the Lord. A must read for any mom considering or beginning homeschooling
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey J Harris

customer_reviews.title: The one book I reread often for encouragement in my homeschool
customer_reviews.text: No matter what method you do for homeschooling, this book is an encouragement. I often buy it or recommend it to my friends who are struggling, thinking they have to do it all. No you don’t. Rest is possible. Thank you Sarah for this little gem of a book.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: BEST BOOK EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I have read this book 3 times! Not that this book is a in depth book that is hard to read. It is a very easily read book with BIG TRUTHS! So I re-read it to get it to stick in my brain that Teaching from Rest is where I want to live from. This book has had a huge impact on me and my homeschool even after 19 years of homeschooling. If all mothers could grasp and practice these truths their homes would be filled with a love for learning and great joy each day. Not that this is a place we arrive at, but a journey we are on!
customer_reviews.author: ccmama23

customer_reviews.title: I guarantee you will be inspired and delighted!!
customer_reviews.text: In my 15+ years as a homeschooling mother, with the hundreds of books and articles I've read on the topic, I can honestly say that THIS is the book that was most helpful. If I could choose just one book to place in the hands of every perspective homeschooling parent, it would be this book. It is that insightful and Sarah has such a vast wealth of wisdom to share. Absolutely read this book -- if you're considering homeschooling or if you're a seasoned veteran. I guarantee you will be inspired and delighted!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I cannot say enough good things about this book
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this book. It came at just the right time for me it didn't take forever to read and it was super packed with encouragement that my weary heart needed. It has helped me to refocus this year and I've highlighted a lot of different things through the book that I intend on rough days or moments to go back reread and remember the importance of what we're doing in our home. Highly recommend this book to any home-school parent.
customer_reviews.author: Mom life!

customer_reviews.title: Made me be ok with homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: I started reading this book at a time when I was doubting whether I was cut out to be a Homeschool mom. While I still have my doubts, this book reassured me that I can do it and not freak out about doing it perfectly. That I can teach my kids in my own style and at their own pace. That I can teach from rest. I highly recommend this book to anyone thinking about homeschooling... It's a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah S.

customer_reviews.title: Small gem of a book
customer_reviews.text: This book is a small gem! Even after homeschooling for 12 years I found this book helpful! Great reminders about what our priorities should be and not biting off more than we can (or should) chew!
customer_reviews.author: Karen D

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully written
customer_reviews.text: This book is beautifully written and vey genuine. We don't homeschool for religious purposes, but I was still able to gain a great deal of insight into the beauty of functioning from a calm and peaceful space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed
customer_reviews.text: I am going on my 3rd time reading this book. Sarah is down to earth, real and gets life in the trenches as a homeschooling Mom. I said a prayer of repentance as I realized I was trying to do this in my own strength. Thank you Sarah for pointing me to Jesus again and again. A must read for any Mom who might be weary and needing encouragement.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Keller

customer_reviews.title: A homeschool resource must
customer_reviews.text: This book speaks directly to the homeschooling Mom who thinks she is the end all be all in her child's education. The Mom who feels a self-inflicted pressure and guilt to "get it all in". Sarah perfectly details a game plan (for all the planners out there) on steps to take to teach from rest and to enjoy the homeschooling journey. Then she brings it home with the gentle reminder of exactly where we have to draw our strength as mothers and homeschooling moms. Beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sarah is like she is in my head... her lighthearted writing paired ...
customer_reviews.text: Must read for all homeschooling Mommas- read and be refreshed!! Sarah is like she is in my head... her lighthearted writing paired with truth is like balm to the soul!! We are so easily caught in lies and trail after the yellow bus- be refreshed and find freedom in Christ as Sarah leads us beside the Word and our great God who fills all the gaps!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Homeschooling Book Out There
customer_reviews.text: This is a book I find myself coming back to again and again. There is so much encouragement that inspires me to press on. I love practical information, the personal examples and spiritual encouragement offered in this book. This one's a gem, and I'll likely read it several times a year. I have no doubt that each time I read it, I will find a new nugget of encouragement to hold on to. I love the length of the book, as well. It's easy to pick up and read in a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Foley

customer_reviews.title: ... there on homeschooling but this is by far my favorite! I HIGHLY
customer_reviews.text: There are many books out there on homeschooling but this is by far my favorite! I HIGHLY, HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend it for anyone who homeschools. Since I got the Kindle version a year ago, I have read it 3x through and skimmed it a couple of other times for encouragement. It's amazing how Sarah can convey such a powerful message in such a simple and easy to read book without it being too basic and redundant. If you need a fresh boost of encouragement as you teach your children at home, this is the book for you! Draw a hot bubble bath, light a candle, and settle in for a good read!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Swinborne

customer_reviews.title: I will be rereading this book all the time!
customer_reviews.text: Every Catholic momma to needs this book. Preferably daily. I don't homeschool but I found all of her advice to be practical and something that I could start using right away. The biggest take away I got was that we are called to be faithful, not successful, and that we will find true joy in surrendering to God. I need the constant reminder of that amidst the chaos of daily life.
customer_reviews.author: A. Compton

customer_reviews.title: Inspirational for Homeschooling Mothers
customer_reviews.text: I think most homeschooling mothers can relate to this book. We often stress too much, obsess too much and take on way too much to fully complete anything. It can leave us feeling like a failure when we do not live up to our own standard. Mackenzie does a beautiful job working through what teaching from rest is and how to obtain this. It's not some utopian idea; it's real and obtainable. After reading this book, our days became more relaxed and our time together has been more productive and more joyful. This book has changed our homeschool completely. This is a definite must read!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Priceless
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mom who's at the beginning of homeschooling and this book was a HUGE encouragement to me! The author seems to come alongside, give your shoulders a squeeze, and say, "Relax, you can do this. Here, let me help you figure out what's most important to you." The companion audio (not sure if it's available here, I think I bought it directly from classical academic press) is also incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Lois K

customer_reviews.title: Wisdom!
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing! There were so many times I found myself saying out loud "Yes!Yes!" much to my family's dismay. Sarah pours wisdom and truth into this book thay spoke to me. We have made changes in the way we homeschool thanks to this book and our days are so much better! Thank you for permission to stop checking boxes and the reminder to check our hearts. I recommend this book for every homeschooling parent!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as I thought it would be. Gets a lot of hype.
customer_reviews.author: RedHeads3

customer_reviews.title: One of my all time favorite homeschooling books
customer_reviews.text: I've retread this book multiple times, and I think I will continue to read it yearly just to reset my mind frame as I start each school year. It is refreshing to find a homeschooling book that doesn't revisit the same themes as all the other homeschooling books. This is a new perspective, and one which the homeschooling community truly needed. And, yes, I truly needed it too.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: This book was so helpful for helping you to refocus and review why you are homeschooling your children! Inspired me to change my thinking and try new things for this school year so the curriculum is not driving me but I am in control of my day and my method of schooling my children.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book saved my homeschooling career! It's an incredible encouragement to anyone anywhere on their homeschooling journey! I was worn out after 3 years of what felt like failed homeschooling with very little ones and Sarah gave me hope and encouragement to keep going. I recommend this book over and over to everyone I talk to about homeschooling!
customer_reviews.author: Harmony Kaufenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great encouragement
customer_reviews.text: Thanks, Sarah, for expressing your experiences and pointing us to the Lord Jesus. I love your long-term view of our work. I am glad for your encouragement to associate with other women. I too, have found this strengthening. Teaching from Rest -- I'll cherish those words this year.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Eunice

customer_reviews.title: A must-read for any parents diving into homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This was an inspiring book filled with practical advice and tested methods. I highlighted and underlined like I never had before. As a mom who never intended to homeschool her kids, but is now going to, I needed a read like this to help get inspired and most of all, to help get my priorities straight! Sarah Mackenzie is filled with wisdom and grace in her writing!
customer_reviews.author: KatieGirl

customer_reviews.title: My annual “must read” for a dose of encouragement!
customer_reviews.text: This is my holy-grail of home education books. A true encouragement for those of us in this journey, charting our own course when God gives us our “marching orders.” It’s a quick read, but incredibly rich in insight and encouragement. I read it at least once a year as a home educating mama who has been in the game for over 11 years. It is faith-based so it’s likely best for those coming from the Christian walk of life.
customer_reviews.author: PRU

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book! I'm not a reader and it's a MUST READ!!
customer_reviews.text: This book has zero fluff. I found myself highlighting nearly every word! I have given many copies to friends since reading it. It is powerful, convicting, encouraging, and a MUST READ for homeschool mamas (and I'm not normally a reader!)
customer_reviews.author: OTTracy

customer_reviews.title: A must for homeschooling parents!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this book. It gives some great suggestions on how to make things a little more easy for us homeschool parents. Most importantly it reminds us why we began homeschooling in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brockington

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: I love this author and her podcasts, blog posts and books. Can't wait to receive Read-Aloud Family! She is a peaceful and fabulous writer who practices what she preaches. I love an author who understands my big, Catholic homeschooling family and speaks to it using Scripture and her own personal experience. Great book.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf5

customer_reviews.title: Not just a Homescbooler’s Guide but a LIFE GUIDS
customer_reviews.text: In just a few chapters, Sarah was preaching more than she was writing — tackling productivity and how it gets in the way of truly engaging with what’s in front of you. This is my first year homeschooling, and I felt not only refreshed but prepared and empowered to walk confidently into my new role as teacher.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Panariso

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy read!
customer_reviews.text: Love Sarah McKenzie and this book was a perfect read for me during my first year of homeschooling. She gave me good little nuggets to remember during the stressful moments.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: A must read!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! I definitely recommend for any homeschooling mom! A much needed read almost yearly to remind myself to teach from rest! Packed full of great ideas and practical tips on slowing things down. It challenged my entire way of thinking and because of it I made some pretty great changes in our homeschool day! We have all benefited!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn B.

customer_reviews.title: A life changing book for homeschooling moms
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have read many books which I was sure would revolutionize my approach to my home, family, and teaching. Yet none of them really hit the mark. Some were too little, some to much. "Teaching from Rest" is just right, and rightly ordered. Drawing from the works of CS Lewis, GK Chesterton as well as her own experience the author encourages us in truly educating our children, and ourselves. I look forward to going back through the book, with the companion workbook and really processing how to make some real positive changes for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunda Penny

customer_reviews.title: Rest and Education
customer_reviews.text: The decision to homeschool took a lot of prayer and discussion. We have good days and bad. I've never been sorry about this decision.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I will NEVER buy a book from this author again.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this book 2 stars for the very little advice on homeschooling and how the spiritual advice was poorly portrayed. However, I really wanted to give it 1 star because of a paragraph in which rubbed me the wrong way and makes me wonder how the author views Jesus. In that one paragraph she makes Him sound careless, wreckless, insufficient, and selfish. I will NEVER buy a book by this author again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Sarah Mackenzie
customer_reviews.text: I love Sarah Mackenzie! This book is a collection of her ideas from her amazing website at Read Aloud Revival. I plan to re-read it often. I tend to slide into doing too much too fast, and I needed this reminder to put the brakes on and enjoy this time with my kids. Highly recommend it for homeschooling moms!
customer_reviews.author: MomOfSix

customer_reviews.title: Must read for people of faith
customer_reviews.text: I'm a devout Muslim and part time home schooling dad and I found this to be a very beneficial book. It was recommended by "Our Muslim Homeschool" on Facebook/YouTube. Its teachings and counsels resonated with me a lot especially as it puts God at the center of all of our concerns and daily activities. I would recommend this as a must read for any person of faith.
customer_reviews.author: Riyaz

customer_reviews.title: Quick, and straightforward encouragement
customer_reviews.text: This book is FANTASTIC! A must read for Christian home school moms. Read it each summer break for a quick refresher on why you homeschool in the first place:)
customer_reviews.author: Jayness

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Book
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, this is the absolute most practical and inspirational book I've read concerning homeschool. This book has helped me to narrow my focus, quiet my heart, and allow the Holy Spirit to guide me through each day. It's filled with very practical tips, from which I've begun to bear fruit in just a short time. This appears to be a short read, but it is MEATY!! Pull out your highlighters, and enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: ReadingMom

customer_reviews.title: As essential as fresh pencils for the home educator!
customer_reviews.text: Last year was my first year homeschooling and I wavered between being both incredibly excited and terrified! There were so many resources available - how could I ever choose the best one for my family!? Sarah is a breath of fresh air for the weary or questioning home educator. I am armed with new ideas to create a calm and encouraging atmosphere of learning this coming year.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Teaching Humans, not Robots
customer_reviews.text: Madam Mackenzie shows us how to teach humans rather than a bunch of factory robots. This is a must read for homeschoolers and teachers. Will have to meditate much on this and figure out how to implement it in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: A great motivational “talk” for a stressed out homeschooling mom
customer_reviews.text: An excellent guide to finding peace amidst the high stress and demands of homeschooling your children. Take a deep breath, fix a cup of tea, hide away from the kiddos to get this book read. It’ll change your perspective, but it isn’t a license to let everything go to chance. It’s about homeschooling and living a purposeful day with joy and peace. Who couldn’t use more of that?
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Teaching from Rest reminds a homeschooling mother to reorient her ...
customer_reviews.text: Teaching from Rest reminds a homeschooling mother to reorient her thoughts and goals to reflect a more holistic approach to learning when designing the curriculum for her children; one that nurtures the intellect and soul. As many of us are products of traditional schooling, this book reminds mothers (and fathers) that the goal of education should be a humanizing one, not just an education that emphasizes productivity and "success" measured in scores, scholarships, and acceptance letters to top schools. Sarah Mackenzie accomplishes this by sharing wisdom and insights on "schole", restful learning, showing you that it is achievable and realistic for the homeschooling family.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute must have for encouraging parents on homeschooling journey. This book is thin, short and to the point. I love to read it twice a year.
customer_reviews.author: lana

customer_reviews.title: Spoke to my heart.
customer_reviews.text: As a homeschooling mom, I needed to hear these words before school started. Even though it is important I don't have to worry about checking off the boxes of every day. It is more important to give my days over to the Lord and praise Him for what happens every day. No matter if that is a great day or one where the milk carton is spilled every meal.
customer_reviews.author: Jayda

customer_reviews.title: So far I've enjoyed the book
customer_reviews.text: So far I've enjoyed the book, frustrated that you buy it, and then she references to a bunch of other stuff on a website that you should read before hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with this book is that it is WAY to thin for the cost. The with of my pinky is wides then the book is thick, and I have thin pinkys.. It was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn.brandon

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: All teachers should read this! This is thought provoking and life changing! I read it before each school year to refresh my heart!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Whitfield

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed this book
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this book. Sarah speaks very directly to the issue at hand for many moms -- homeschooling or not. What are you parenting for? Who are you parenting for? Ch 1 esp speaks to this issue, while 2 and 3 are more specific for those who are homeschooling. Sarah helped me think through the basic reasons I'm wanting to homeschool and how I want (and don't want) to go about it. Thank you, Sarah!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Younger

customer_reviews.title: Love.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, READ THIS. I mean it's taking me forever, I think I'm only 20 pages in and that's after a month or two, but it's a really good, encouraging, convicting, and exhorting read that every mother (homeschooler or not) should read IMO.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chikeles

customer_reviews.title: Easy read, great encouragement!
customer_reviews.text: Very encouraging, and relatable for a homeschool mom! Easy, and quick to read. Has some great resources included to expand your knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S

customer_reviews.title: Absolute must read
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a must for homeschooling moms. There is a ton in there as well that moms who don’t homeschool could benefit from as well. I actually just loaned my copy to my empty nester mother. This is going to be my go to referenced through our homeschooling. Incredibly thankful for the wisdom in here and for having this in my personal library .
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Best homeschool encouragement book yet
customer_reviews.text: The best, and most encouraging, book on homeschooling that I've read. It has changed my life as a homeschool mama. A great pick-me-up for moms in the trenches of homeschooling. I am aiming to read this twice a year- before the start of the school year and again when I'm feeling burnt out!
customer_reviews.author: mommalove

customer_reviews.title: A much needed read!
customer_reviews.text: A much needed read for a homeschooling mama! I will need to read this at least once more this year.
customer_reviews.author: Acustomer

customer_reviews.title: I'm not finished with this book b/c it's good in small doses
customer_reviews.text: I'm not finished with this book b/c it's good in small doses. I'll edit it if my opinion changes, but it's really insightful. I needed some encouragement to begin our new homeschool year and it's really been helpful for that. You should see how much I've already highlighted it or underlined it. There are lots of good tidbits I want and need to remember from this.
customer_reviews.author: AmieM

customer_reviews.title: This book is like a breath of fresh air in my home
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 children and I've been homeschooling for 10 years now. This book is like a breath of fresh air in my home. With so many children and so many subjects to juggle, homeschooling can seem overwhelming, but Sarah Mackenzie reminds us WHY we homeschool and gives us practical (useful!) tips for planning our homeschool day. You won't be disappointed! I also recommend her podcast - Read Aloud Revival. So much goodness to be heard there and you can listen while you fold laundry :)
customer_reviews.author: emilyjames

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad book, good.ideas
customer_reviews.text: Quite good. It leans heavy on religion, but the ideas behind it are something to think about and implement. It is a short book and fast read but worthy of a highlighter. All in all, not a bad buy, not the best book on homeschooling and by far not the worst.
customer_reviews.author: TLPM

customer_reviews.title: Great book of encouragement
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best and most encouraging homeschool books I've read to date. It reminded me of all the reasons I homeschool and why I need to depend on Jesus. I'd say this is a must read for all Christian homeschoolers.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette D. Larson

customer_reviews.title: A Must Read for Homeschool Mom's
customer_reviews.text: Feeling like your drowning in curriculum? Always feel like you should be doing more? Feeling exhausted and burned out? This is a must read about how to rest in God and bring forth only what you have to give, trust that God will fill in the rest!
customer_reviews.author: B. Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: What an inspirational book for homeschooling your children!
customer_reviews.text: Sarah MacKenzie is a modern day saint! Her wisdom and deep foundation in Christ has inspired my husband and I with hope and confidence to take our children's education in a deeper direction to help them grow in knowledge but also grow in the image of Jesus! Reading this book will be a huge benefit to you and your family!
customer_reviews.author: E. Otte

customer_reviews.title: A must read for a homeschool mom and dad!
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I read this before I started homeschooling 11 years ago! Better mate than never! My 16 yr old, 13 yr old and 8 yr old will have a mom focused on “ Schole’” learning from here on out and we will all benefit! My next step will be to make sure my husband reads this as well because I feel we need to be a team supporting this new journey in teaching from rest!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Barkley

customer_reviews.title: So good, and like Crystal Paine's review on the inside ...
customer_reviews.text: So good, and like Crystal Paine's review on the inside cover says, it's worth a re-read several times a year. We lose our focus so easily and need to re-focus on a regular basis. And unlike so many homeschooling books, this one is completely burden-less. Just gives a lot of freedom and room to breathe.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: A must read for ALL homeschool parents
customer_reviews.text: This book is a quick read, but penetrates your soul and turns your ideology on its head. Do you get caught up in all you SHOULD be doing? Do yourself and your family a favor and read this book. It will be so refreshing and offer you so much peace.
customer_reviews.author: B&A

customer_reviews.title: Quit my job because of this book.
customer_reviews.text: Everything you already know and feel but in the context of homeschool. Changed my prospective. You need to read this every FEB/MARCH
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Read it before every school year!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great book! It's short, simple, and profound. It's encouraging and also very practical. I read it before every school year as an encouragement for my heart and a renewal of vision.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful to a new homeschooler
customer_reviews.text: Lots of wisdom packed into a small package. Changed the way I think about "rest".
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S.

customer_reviews.title: The book of the year for me.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot sing the praises of this beautiful little book enough. Reading it, rereading it, listening to the Audible version, and relistening to it has been like applying and reapplying a soothing salve to my homeschooling soul. I have taken the idea of Scholé, first discovered in this book, seriously. I am striving to make my life and home a Scholé sanctuary for myself and my family. I hope Sarah will continue to write. I certainly look forward to more truth, goodness, and beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: From One Mama heart to Another, PLEASE READ!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the audible book and I have taken so many notes I think I rewrote most of it by hand. It came to me just in time as we begin our homeschool journey with our four year old. Her words hit home. I could only listen for a few minutes before I had to stop and pray through the notes I would write. Jesus is that unshakeable peace and she sends an invitation into knowing His rest.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by Many
customer_reviews.text: This book was recommended to me by many seasoned homeschool moms in their approach. This book has given me a wonderful outlook as we begin the journey.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

product_meta.title: Teaching from Rest: A Homeschooler's Guide to Unshakable Peace
